title: Playing Two Notes Together
description: Practice holding two notes at the same time — the first step toward playing chords.

steps.title: Why Two Notes?
steps.description: Playing two notes simultaneously is the foundation of harmony. When you combine notes, they create intervals — the building blocks of all chords. Let's practice pressing and holding two keys at once.

steps.title: C and D Together
steps.description: Hold C4 and D4 at the same time. These adjacent notes create a Major 2nd interval.
steps.hint: Press both keys and hold them simultaneously.

steps.title: C and E Together
steps.description: Now hold C4 and E4. This wider interval (Major 3rd) sounds brighter.
steps.hint: E4 is two white keys above C4.

steps.title: C and G Together
steps.description: Hold C4 and G4 together. This is a Perfect 5th — a very stable, open sound.

steps.title: E and A Together
steps.description: Now try E4 and A4 — a Perfect 4th interval.

steps.title: D and B Together
steps.description: Hold D4 and B4 — a Major 6th. This wide interval has a sweet, warm quality.

steps.title: Interval Quiz
steps.description: When you play C and G together, what interval is that?
